Job Title: VP, Media Relations

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Public Relations, Writing/Editing

Description:
Day One Agency—AdAge’s #4 on the A-List —is hiring!
We’re looking for a brand reputation-focused VP, Media Relations to join our rising team. The successful candidate will be ambitious, hard-working, and dedicated to telling stories that blend corporate and consumer earned storytelling. 
You’ll take pride in your work, show initiative, and go the extra mile to ensure that our clients are served in the best way possible. We’re looking for self-starters with a combination of cross-channel, consumer and corporate comms experience who are willing to work collaboratively and quickly with our squad. Excellent organizational skills are imperative. In return, you’ll be in a rewarding learning environment with a great opportunity to grow and further your knowledge and career. 
Our company culture is at the core of everything we do. It defines our vibe. It’s what makes every day, day one. We offer a highly collaborative, hybrid work environment where smart and hyper-passionate people come together to solve creative communications challenges. It’s no secret; we work hard, but only on the things we love. From the day this agency was created, we vowed to only work on projects that fire us up and that’s still true. It’s how we make projects like Chipotle’s Corn Kid or American Express’ first sneaker drop at NBA All-Star come to life. 
We emphasize and value all of our relationships—they’re what power us. Our colleagues, clients, and partners are the most important part of our business. So if you want to join a fast-growing, award-winning, creative team, we’d love to hear from you. 
This role is full-time, requires a hybrid work schedule, and is only available in New York City. 
Overview
This comms-focused VP, Media Relations will focus on creating, driving and advancing key communications projects that cross over into the world of both corporate and consumer storytelling across owned and earned channels.
The role is built for the future of earned media and the quickly changing media landscape, with an emphasis on being a driver and client lead across key communications clients including American Express. 
The ideal candidate has experience working to concept and deliver across consumer-driven comms projects with earned coverage and conversation as the output. Collaborating with senior-level executives to shape and share their owned and earned strategies is also a must.
Responsibilities
Responsibilities for this role will include serving as a strategic counselor to clients and as a team leader across our communications business. This person will be responsible for developing strong corporate and consumer communications strategies that proactively and reactively build and protect brand reputation and achieve key business objectives. In addition to team management and mentorship experience, we are also looking for someone who can be a part of new business and management decisions.
Act as a thought-partner for senior-level clients and our agency by understanding their business and driving results while showcasing client leadership and relationship building skillsShowcase a keen understanding for the brand-level positioning for our clients and lead corporate and consumer communications strategies and activations to meet those goalsRaise the visibility of brands and key executives via earned and owned social strategies - tap into the topics their fans and audiences loveDevelop and deliver informed strategic recommendations based on understanding of best practices across each client’s category and competitive setInterface directly with key clients and executives at a macro level when building plans and strategies and at a micro level in implementing those approachesMaintain current knowledge of trends, the competitive landscape, and confidently provide strategic point-of-views to clientsProactively anticipate client needs and keep multiple activities moving simultaneouslyCounsel junior members of the team to work effectively with the media, and develop their skill sets in the agency settingParticipate in new business pitch development and/or presentationsDrive office culture and be a mentor to staff Create strategic plans, decks and presentations on behalf of agency and its clients, including generating ongoing new ideas and value beyond the scope of current client assignments
Requirements
10+ years of experience in media relations or related fieldUnderstanding of the intersection between corporate and consumer storytelling Experience working with creative teams to build effective strategies and campaignsCreative storytelling skills coupled with a deep understanding of how to package a modern earned story, understanding the importance of visual elementsExperience developing media strategies and strong media relationshipsExperience developing and executing programs that drive tangible resultsExperience managing multiple priorities and pivoting quicklyExperience leading and mentoring a diverse teamExperience supporting and delivering success across a wide range of assignments and client categories — including travel, financial services, lifestyle, consumer tech, fashion and beverageEntrepreneurial spirit and relentless curiosity Excellent judgment and people interaction skillsExcellent communication and writing skills
Preferred Skills  Prior PR agency experience Prior experience leading integrated corporate and consumer communications strategies, brand partnerships, and large-scale event activationsBachelor's Degree
Compensation + Benefits
We value all of our employees and are happy to provide comprehensive benefits to help support them holistically in the best way we can. We offer all our employees:
Health Care (Medical, Dental, Vision)Paid Time Off and Company Paid HolidaysSummer Fridays401K Retirement Plan with Company MatchLifestyle Spending AccountPaid Parental LeaveCommuter BenefitsCompany Credit CardUber Business AccountNew Business Referral BonusEmployee Referral Bonus
The Company is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices. The base compensation range for this role is $160,000-$200,000 and this position is eligible for benefits that include medical insurance (health, dental, and vision), retirement plan, paid time off, paid parental leave, new business and employee referral bonuses, etc. Please note that the compensation information provided is a good faith estimate for New York City based hires only and is provided pursuant to the New York City Pay Transparency Law. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as candidates' relevant work experience, skills, qualifications, and location.

Experience Level (if available): Executive
